intro: Tanacetum pakistanicum, commonly known as the Kashmir chrysanthemum, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of the Himalayas, particularly in Pakistan and northern India. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of ray and disk florets. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring hairy, lance-shaped leaves and yellow to white ray florets. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in meadows and rocky slopes at elevations above 2,000 meters. Tanacetum pakistanicum is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been used in traditional medicine for its potential therapeutic properties.
